title: The Counterfeit Cameo
setting: Hargrove Auction House, appraisal room, Saturday morning
premise: A Victorian-era shell cameo brooch appraised at forty thousand dollars was swapped for a worthless replica before Saturday's auction. The switch happened sometime after Friday's final appraisal at 4 PM. The real cameo is missing.

suspects.name: Genevieve Rourke
suspects.motive: Performed the original appraisal and could profit by selling the real one to a private collector
suspects.alibi: I completed the final appraisal Friday at 4 PM and locked the piece in the display safe. I left the building at 4:30 and attended a gallery opening on Beacon Street from 6 to 9 PM.

suspects.name: Philip Dane
suspects.motive: Collects Victorian jewelry and knows a private buyer willing to pay cash with no questions asked
suspects.alibi: I was the last staff member in the building Friday. I set the alarm at 7 PM and went straight to Murphy's Pub to watch the football match. I was there until closing at midnight.

suspects.name: Irene Valdez
suspects.motive: The cameo's seller promised her a private cash bonus if the piece fetched above estimate at auction
suspects.alibi: I left work at 5 PM Friday. I was home all evening preparing auction catalog descriptions on my laptop. My email outbox shows I sent three catalog drafts between 7 and 10 PM.

suspects.name: Malcolm Trent
suspects.motive: Hired to photograph lots and had unsupervised access to the appraisal room while shooting Friday
suspects.alibi: I finished photographing auction lots at 3 PM Friday and left before the final appraisal. I drove to my studio in Millbrook, forty minutes away, to process the images for the catalog.

clues.title: Alarm System Log
clues.content: The building alarm was set at 7:02 PM Friday and disarmed at 6:15 AM Saturday by the morning manager. But the alarm log also shows a brief disarm-rearm cycle at 11:48 PM Friday using Philip's staff code.

clues.title: Bartender's Account
clues.content: The bartender at Murphy's Pub confirms Philip arrived around 7:15 PM but says he left abruptly around 11 PM, well before closing. Philip told him he had forgotten something at work.

clues.title: Pub Location Check
clues.content: Murphy's Pub is a six-minute drive from the auction house. Philip claimed he was at the pub until midnight, but Clues 1 and 2 show he left at 11 PM and used his alarm code at 11:48 PM. His alibi window has a gap he cannot explain.

hints.text: Focus on who had the means to re-enter the building after hours on Friday night.
Someone claims they stayed out all evening, but did they really stay put the entire time?
